name: COFFINED / CONFFINED
description: In the English language, are we able to take a static word and through magic of proximity and context create a completely unique narrative that showcases several concepts? Without a doubt, yes. Take for instance the word CONFINED, if we happened to drop an "F" bomb right on top of CONFINED, we get COFFINED; as if to intimate something sudden and terrible occurred, thus knocking the "N" out of CONFINED and dropping to a pile of other "N"s. The narrative we could associate is we live our lives in a confined box, thinking we know everything that is within that box, only to get the fucked ultimately by death. Then placed in a coffin and then buried. Short, simple, and right to the point.
